messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] interesting collection
messages.msgSnippet: Rich, Kofun period tsuba come up at auction from time to time.  The Compton and Lundgren sales come to mind.  I have two. There was a small iron hoju guard for
messages.messageBody:
Rich,
Kofun period tsuba come up at auction from time to time. The Compton and Lundgren sales come to mind. I have two. There was a small iron hoju guard for sale at a show in the states a few years ago. Of course you can see plenty of them in Japanese museums and books on the period.

The corrosion pattern on that tsuba isn't consistent with the pieces I've seen. The rim is deeply eroded, but the other edges and the surface are in great shape with no distortion. Not sure if Tom was joking, but I wouldn't be surprised if he's right.

Jim



http://page8.auctions.yahoo.co.jp/jp/auction/h19401221

authentic ?, I often wonder how frequently old tsuba such as Hoju and
Tôran Kei are seen.

RIch


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New to all this
messages.msgSnippet: Ran, I d be very worried of anything coming out of Shanghai. With so many fake swords coming out of China, be very very cautious. Have a look at this page for
messages.messageBody:
Ran, I'd be very worried of anything coming out of Shanghai. With so
many fake swords coming out of China, be very very cautious. Have a look
at this page for some assistance is trying to spot the difference.

Fake Japanese Swords
<http://members.westnet.com.au/whiz/richard/Nihonto_Message_Board/Fake_Japanese_Swords.htm>

Rich

messages.messageBody:
Alright Ladies and Gents, I am new to this but a have a friend
sending me a couple old Katanas from Shang Hi. I'll be able post
